choices.text: Let's see what I have on me...
Should I just call it QUITs?

pages.text: What now?

choices.text: No. A girl's gone missing. I'm her only hope.

pages.text: Maybe I should forget about this whole business and just go home?
Where to?
Good to see you're still in possession of all your organs!

Hey man, you don't look like you're from around these parts.

This alleyway is one of the nicest in the Gutter, but if you go sticking your nose where it don't belong, you might end up an involuntary organ donor.

Lucky for you, I'm kind of a tour guide, and I don't need your organs. Name's Glitch, by the way.

choices.text: Where's good place to eat around here?
Do you know anything about a girl that went missing recently?
Let me put it another way, where could I get my hands on some Coral?
Alright Glitch, I did what you asked. Now tell me the password.
I need your special brand of help.
Do you know who the man in this photo is?

pages.text: So, what do you want to know?
I'll be here if you need me.
Life is the only thing cheaper than the thrills at the Alleycat. If I were you, I'd be careful you don't get eaten alive.

Takeshi's noodles was the best place, and just around the corner too. 

It's a shame he had to close up shop.
Both.

Ever the enterprising spirit, he decided to branch out.

Let's just say that ramen weren't the only noods he started selling, if you catch my drift. Made a few enemies.
Now his enterprising spirit probably haunts these alleyways...
Ok, listen up because I'm only going to say this once...
No.

Coral? You don't look like you got the hardware to enjoy it, but who am I to judge.

Acid Nova's the only one selling it, and the Alleycat's the only place to find him. But good luck getting in.
They don't just let any scorched junkie in. You got to be vetted. Even if you had a ticket, you'd still need a password.

choices.text: I'll bite. Where can I get the password.
You have a bead on a ticket?

pages.text: Lucky for you, I have one and know where to find the other.
That's the lucky part! I have the password and I'd be happy to scratch your back if you scratch mine. It'll be no problem, especially for you.

choices.text: You're a real Mother Theresa. What do you need me to do?

pages.text: Cred- what? No! No, nothing like that. Well, I guess it something like that. But I don't take money from people, there's so little of it to go around. Nah, I like to make the corpos bleed a little green, if you know what I mean.

choices.text: If it's so easy, why don't you do it?

pages.text: It's simple. All you have to do is take this magical credstick and let it do its voodoo in the cash machine nearby. That's all. Honest.

choices.text: Ok, fine. Give me the stick.

pages.text: *cough* Well, they got a tin-man standing in front of it and he's already got my scent. You, on the other hand, he doesn't know.
Alright, there's this guy Tweaker. He's a real chrome job and usually does business out by the subway. He can probably get you a ticket.

And how! Man, that's a lot of credits...

Oh right! The password is Dyonisus. Good luck my friend, and if you need anything else, you just let me know!

choices.text: I need to get access to someone's computer.
1 n33d y0ur l33t h4xx0r sk1llz p0wn1ng b00m3r's 'put3r lolz

pages.text: I'm intrigued, what do you need?
*SWOON* You sure know how to speak to a girl.
Alright, I got some thing for ya. If you can get physical access to the computer and plug this data stick in any port, it'll clone all of its data.

choices.text: What's it going to cost me?

pages.text: Then you plug it into your computer and you can view all the data!

choices.text: Or you can just give it to me because you made lots of credits off my back.

pages.text: Well, you see, I need you to get me special McGuffin that's in the possession of some guy who'll be happy to trade it for you if you can solve his problem...

choices.text: Wait... how do I know it's safe to plug in to my computer, that it's not going to do something else?

pages.text: Fine, fine. You're no fun.

choices.text: Looks like I got no choice... Very well, now to find a way to access the computer without that fossil noticing...

pages.text: You're just going to have to trust me!

choices.text: No. Bad Glitch. No more fetch quests. Just tell me.

pages.text: I can't say I do... however, I have heard something. If you could get me--
Fine. Fine. I saw him talking to Acid Nova about some kind of deal. I don't have any other details, I swear.
What do you want, chump?
No ticket, no password: no entry. No exception.
Man, get drek out of my face!
They just give these out to any drek these days. What's the password?
Get the drek out of my face!
Very well, Mr...
Very well, Mr. Steel. Right this way.

choices.text: I need to use the jackpot.

pages.text: *Ksssh* MOVE ALONG, CITIZEN. *Ksssh*
*Ksssh* NO. *Ksssh*

choices.text: I really need to get my money.
No flaws with that logic, have a good evening.

pages.text: *Ksssh* I'M PROTECTING THIS CASH MACHINE. IF NOBODY USES IT, NOBODY CAN VANDALIZE IT. *Ksssh*
*Ksssh* THAT'S YOUR PROBLEM, NOW GET LOST *Ksssh*
*Ksssh* NO *Ksssh*

choices.text: Yes. I asked you if you're a dreking idiot.

pages.text: *Ksssh* DO YOU WANT TO SAY THAT AGAIN? *Ksssh*

choices.text: Think about it. How much money is the bank losing by you making it impossible to withdraw creds?

pages.text: *Ksssh* YOU HAVE TWO SECONDS TO GET OUT OF MY FACE BEFORE I REARRANGE YOURS *Ksssh*

choices.text: Well that's good! You saved them from paying for a coat of paint and only losing thousands in transaction fees.

pages.text: *Ksssh* ERR... AH... WELL... AT LEAST IT'S NOT GETTING VANDALIZED *Ksssh*

choices.text: Best case scenario, they shut this jackpot down because it brings in no money and you lose your job. Worst case, they sue you for lost revenue. Good luck.

pages.text: *Ksssh* YEAH, BUT... *Ksssh*
*Ksssh* FINE! FINE! YOU CAN USE IT, JUST BE QUICK *Ksssh*
Depends on who's asking.
Well, I have no idea who you are. Get lost.

choices.text: I'm here for business, Glitch sent me.

pages.text: A PI? You're one 'G' short.

choices.text: She said you could get me a ticket for the Alleycat.

pages.text: Glitch needs to keep her mouth shut. What do you want?
The Alleycat? They're going to eat you alive. What could someone like you possibly want with that pleasure palace?
*laughs* Good dreking luck with that.
Who?

choices.text: I'll take that as a 'yes.' What happened to her?

pages.text: Ah shit.

choices.text: Thanks for your concern. Nonetheless, I need a ticket.

pages.text: Look man, the Alleycat swallows people whole, if you value your life, stay away.

choices.text: You don't know what I can afford.

pages.text: Alright, let's say I had a ticket to sell you, you couldn't afford it.

choices.text: You just want some dreking noodles?

pages.text:
You can't afford it because what want you can't get.

Nobody's ever going to get any more of Takeshi's noods, on account of him mysteriously 404ing.

choices.text: I think you underestimate how resourceful I am.

pages.text:
Not just any noods! Takeshi's! The man was a master of his craft, and he alway left a small surprise printed on bottom of the bowls... heh heh...

Anyway, no Takeshi, no noods.

choices.text: I told you I am pretty resourceful. This is the last bowl in existence. So if you want it, I'll take one of those tickets.

pages.text: What?! How's that possible?!

choices.text: What's the deal with the noodles anyway?

pages.text: You got a dreking deal! Here's your ticket. Hope you find what you're looking for.

It's not about the noods themselves, but what's at the bottom of the bowl.

Takeshi's started printing nudes on the bottom of his bowls of noods! They're collector's items.
Oh great! You're back.

What do we have here?

No body armor, so you're no
cop. Ya got no hardware, so you're no chrome job.

So... who are you?
Nah, man. I'm keen to guess.

choices.text: I don't have time for this.

pages.text: You go door to door selling drek?

choices.text: I've had enough of this drek.

pages.text: You're an out of luck ambulance chaser?

choices.text: It's like you're not even trying!

pages.text: You're the health inspector come to shut us down?
Judging from your cheap trench coat, I'm guessing you're going to be a pain in my ass.

choices.text: The name's Blake. I heard you're the guy to talk to about Coral.
I'm a PI who's looking for a girl.
Do you know the man on this photo?
Just looking at you, I can tell this is going to be pointless. Bye.

pages.text: What do you want?

choices.text: People keep saying that. What in the drek are you talking about?

pages.text: What could you possibly want from Coral? You don't have the hardware to enjoy it.

choices.text: Why don't you educate me, then.

pages.text: You for real asking me for Coral when you clearly have no idea what it is?

choices.text: Actually, I wanted to talk to you about something else.

pages.text: Coral's a "simstim". It's a digital drug. You need hardware, you need cybernetics in order to partake, my unmodified friend.

choices.text: All that from a computer program? Huh.

pages.text: Exactly what I said. When you insert the coral in your socket, it downloads a program that parties on your neural interface. It messes with the signals that are coming from your cybernetics, giving you a full body high. You feel drek that isn't even happening. It shuts you down while you're chasing those ruby slippers so you don't go running around while stoned out of your mind.

choices.text: ... ergo, you can't get chemically dependent on it, right.

pages.text: It feels great but it's no more addictive than really good sex. Some people can't help themselves and will chase those ruby slippers. It's a simstim, there are no chemicals...

choices.text: But if it's just a program on a data chip, can't people copy it and put you out of a job?

pages.text: It's all in this little red chip. You plug into your socket and it does the rest.
They say it's the brainchild of a biohacker by the name of KryptoKool. As for where I get it, well, I don't think we're close enough friends.

choices.text: ... Good to see that your retirement is secure.

pages.text: Your concern for my livelihood is touching, it really is. But that's the clever bit. The data chip destroys itself when it downloads into you. Or if you tamper with it. It even deletes itself from your system after a random amount of time. Nah, this drek is clever.

choices.text: Look at this picture, you recognize her?

pages.text: Aren't we all?

choices.text: I thought we were just becoming friends and you have to lie to my face?

pages.text: ... never seen her in my life.

choices.text: Her name is Danni Ashton. She did Coral. You are the only Coral dealer in the Gutter.  I'm just trying to find her.

pages.text: How do you figure?

choices.text: Really? Look at the photo again, she's not that forgettable.
Fine. How many credits will it take to jog your RAM?

pages.text: I don't keep track of every chrome job junkie that crosses my path. Get lost.

Let me stop you right there, while I'm still in a good mood. I don't like to be called a liar by a two-bit walking cliche with the aforementioned cheap coat. So you can drop this now and enjoy the delights the Alleycat has to offer, or I can ask Tank, who I believe you already met on your way in to show you the way out.

Am I coming through clear?
What is it with you and showing me photos of people I've never seen?

choices.text: (Bluff) I know all about you deal.

pages.text: You don't know drek about anything.

choices.text: I didn't, but thanks for confirming it for me.

pages.text: *Goes Pale* How do you know about the Coral?

choices.text: I don't think so. Instead you're going to tell me what I want to know or I'll give JV here a call. I'm sure he'd love to know how loose lipped you are about his involvement with Coral.

pages.text: You dreking drek! You stick your nose in my business, you die!
I'm not falling for another one of your bluffs.

choices.text: It seems you have me at a disadvantage, miss...?

pages.text: Act natural, we're just two friends going for a walk. We can't afford to stick out.

choices.text: Err... *cough* uhm, who? Oh right, yes. Yes I am.

pages.text: My name's Crystal. I overheard you talking to that skeez, Acid. Is it true what you said? That you're looking for Danni?

choices.text: I understand she went missing  a few days ago. I'm a private investigator and her father's paying me to find her.
Uhm... err... her father is, uhm looking for her. Is it me or is it getting unseasonably warm?

pages.text: Why? What's your angle?

choices.text: You know my interest in Danni, what about yours?
How do you, uh... how do you know her?

pages.text: Her father, huh? Danni never talks about her family.

choices.text: Do you know anything about what happened to her?

pages.text: Danni's a good friend of mine.

choices.text: What makes you so sure of that?

pages.text: I don't, but it's got to be something bad.

These are dangerous times. We had a system: if one of us stayed out the night, we'd send a message the next morning that all was clear. When she didn't come home and didn't message, I knew something wasn't right.

choices.text: Room mates?! Can we head back to your place then?
Can we... go back to your place?

pages.text: Yes. We're room mates.

choices.text: What? No. I want to search her place, your place, for any clue or indication as to what could have happened.
*cough* Erm.. *blush* No... uh... I mean... *cough* uhm clues...

pages.text: You can't afford me, slick.

choices.text: You don't seem that defenseless to me. Lead the way.
But being funny is one of my strong suits. Oh well.

pages.text: Oh... right! That' makes sense. But don't try anything funny. I'm not as defenseless as I seem.

choices.text: Actually, could you tell me about Danni?
I found this note in her room, what do you make of it?
I did, and it 's not good.
Tell me, have you seen the man in this photo before?

pages.text: Have you found anything yet, Blake?

choices.text: What does Danni do for a living, exactly...
Has she ever mentioned her family to you?

pages.text: Sure, what do you want to know?

We met two years ago. She came into... uh... the shop, looking for work. We started chatting and we've been friends ever since. Eventually we got this place together so that we wouldn't have to live in a dreking hole.

choices.text: I see... and where is this business?
Cyber courtesans, digital doxies, purchased paramours?

pages.text: Danni and I work for a business that caters to the *very expensive* tastes of very wealthy people. Particularly when those tastes have to do with companionship.
Don't be an ass, Blake. Everyone's doing what they can to survive.

choices.text: Hmm... I may have to have a chat with this Gladys.

pages.text: There's a laundromat called the "The Lost Sock". While it's a real, functional, laundromat, it's actually a front for the real business. I don't know who runs it, but Gladys Aubergine is who both Danni and I report up to. She sends us on... assignments.

choices.text: Ugh... that was terrible. Anyway, a have a few more questions.

pages.text: I don't know... she may not be *snicker* "Gladys" to see you.

choices.text: It mentions someone named "15." Any idea who that is?

pages.text: It's a note from Gladys... Danni must have received this just before she went missing.

choices.text: Has she ever mentioned who he is?
A have a few more questions.

pages.text: 15... Danni mentioned him quite a few times. He's got a thing for her. I'd say three quarters of her assignments are with him.
Never. All I know is that he's a big spender. Whatever he wants, he gets.
As you can imagine, discretion is very important in this business. Normally we use code names, and 15 chose his.
No, she never has. But to be fair, neither have I to her. Many people come to the Gutter to get away from their past.

choices.text: It's a long shot, but I still have access to a GovLink machine. If I run her ID, we might be able to turn something up.

pages.text: Her ID? How's that useful?

choices.text: Danni's an orphan. She was never adopted. She chose the name Aston for herself. So the man who introduced himself to me as Jacob Ashton...

pages.text: What do you mean? What is it?
... can't be her father!

choices.text: I don't know yet. Call it a hunch, I think Danni doesn't want to be found. If that's the case, she may be in more danger than we thought.

pages.text: But the who is he?
If there's anything I can do to help, don't hesitate to ask.

choices.text: I need to get close enough to Gladys's computer to plug in this hacktool. It'll clone all the data so I can review it, literally, in the comfort of my own home.
How about dinner and a vid?

pages.text: What do you need?

choices.text: Sounds like a plan. Meet you at the Lost Sock.

pages.text: I could get into shouting match with her. She's got a set of lungs for and old woman, but she's no match for my pair.

choices.text: Uhm... Sounds like a plan. Meet you at the Lost Sock.

pages.text: What was that?

choices.text: No, uhm, I need you to distract Gladys for me.

pages.text: Are you serious?

choices.text: I'd say so. He's the one that hired me.

pages.text: Let me see... yeah. I've seen him a few times. He's picked up Danni whenever she's with 15. Is he related to Danni's disappearance?

choices.text: Exactly. I get the feeling something bad happened that night Danni was with 15. Remember how I said that I think she doesn't want to be found?

pages.text: You mean, he's the one that tried to pass as her father?

choices.text: I think these are the people she doesn't want to be found by.

pages.text: Yeah?
What should I do?
What should I search for?
DATAVAULT 9000

DATAVAULT 9000

User: Gladys Aubergine
Password: gladys1

Access granted...

Lost Sock Personnel List

(About a dozen names scroll by but only two stand out.)

Name: Crystal Shard
Age: 28
Current Assignment: None

Name: Danni Ashton
Age: 24
Current Assignment: 15
(A meaningless list of codenames scrolls by the screen. Eventually I find what I'm looking for.

Customer ID: 15
Preferred Server: DA

Notes:
15 doesn't like to get their hands dirty. Their girls are always picked up by one of his subordinates, JV.

Customer ID: JV
Preferred Server: N/A

Notes:
JV picks up the girls for 15. He's real slippery and I don't trust him, but at least the credits are always good.

Photograph attached.

Entry: Xantech Cybernetics
Summary: Formed 15 years ago by Xander Vane, Xantech Cybernetics has become the world leader in consumer-level cybernetics owning 93% of the market share. Xander Cybernetics is a subsidiary of Cygnus Holdings.

Entry: Xander Vane
Summary: Billionaire genius, is CEO and majority stakeholder of Xantech Cybernetics.

Entry: Cygnus Holdings
Summary: Cygnus Holdings is [REDACTED] and are responsible for [REDACTED]. Their subsidiaries include [LIST REDACTED] and Xantech Cybernetics.

Entry: SummerVault
Summary: SummerVault was formed 4 years ago. Since its inception, SummerVault has specialized in the sale of personal protection vaults and bunkers. Recently it fought off a controversy relating to their vault subscription service, as the capacity they have is a fraction of the lucrative subscriptions they sold.
Last year they were acquired by the Sumerian Collective.

Entry: Sumerian Collective
Summary: Established 7 years ago, the Sumerian Collective have purchased several companies in varied industries. Ironically, they themselves are now a wholly owned subsidiary of Cygnus Holdings.

choices.text: Ok, I got to get back to work

pages.text: Boof.
Bark!

choices.text: That's right! You're a good girl!

pages.text: *Covers her face with her paws*

choices.text: Daisy, I was afraid I would not be a good dog parent but when you walked up to me the first time, I knew I had to try. I want to tell you that you've brought me immeasurable joy and happiness, that you're a ray of sunlight that pierces these dark clouds, that you stirred something in my heart that I never thought I'd feel. I want to tell you these things but I lack an adequate way to express it, so I'll do the best I can and give you all the hugs, walks, and treats that you can take.

It breaks me to think of a future without you, without your goofy smile or long walks, without the joy it brings me when you keep me company in my office or when you fall asleep at my feet. I hope you know how much I love you, even when I  make you get off the couch or keep you from eating my breakfast. I hope you know you left a big paw print on my heart that will never dull.
No matter what happens, I'll always be your dad. I love you sweetie.

pages.text: Go play on some train tracks.
Welcome to the Lost Sock. Laundry and dryer services are 5 credits each, detergent is 2 credits.

At the Lost Sock we strive to make sure that customers leave with a smile.

So smile. And leave me alone.
Do I look like a dating service to you?

choices.text: The name's Steel, Blake Steel. I'm looking for the girl in this photo.

pages.text: ...Who are you?

choices.text: You're going to have to do better than that, Gladys.

pages.text: Never seen her.

choices.text: I know a lot of things. I know that her name is Danni Ashton and that she works for you providing... private laundry services.

pages.text: How do you know my name?
Listen here, Bloke--

choices.text: Are you trying to intimidate me?

pages.text: I don't care what your name is. You have no idea what you're dealing with so take this bit of free advice and leave. Our laundry machines can get even the most stubborn stains out, but they can't wash away broken bones.
No, Brett. There is no reason to intimidate someone who isn't a threat. Good day.
Get your mitts off my computer, Bucko. You even think of getting close to it and you'll find out why they call it a "terminal."

choices.text: That was great! She didn't notice a thing!

pages.text: Hey Blake. How was that?

choices.text: If Glitch is right, then her computer's cloned on this datastick. I just need to plug it into my computer to see everything that's on Glady's. Hopefully that'll lead me somewhere.

pages.text: What's next then?
Sound good. Keep me posted, ok? I'm worried about Danni.
And Blake...?
Be careful.

choices.text: (Better to play long for now) Mr. Ashton, I've investigated Danni's apartment, but it was a dead end.

pages.text: Mr. Steel, have you any news for me?

choices.text: Do not worry. I was just about to hit the street for more information. If she's out there, I'll find her.

pages.text: Unacceptable, Mr. Steel. I'm paying good credits for top results. You assured me you could get those results.

choices.text: Don't worry, I won't stop until she's safe. You can be sure of it.

pages.text: Then get out there and find my Danni!
Mr. Steel, I trust you have an update for me?
*whispering* OK, you win, just hang up!

choices.text: My apologies, I dialed you on accident. I'll report in later. Good bye.

pages.text: I can't hear you, it's very loud where you are.

choices.text: I told you, I'm Blake Steel, PI. I'm looking for Danni who I know you sold Coral too, and JV is somehow playing a part in it. And you were just about to tell me what you know.

pages.text: Who the drek are you?

choices.text: What do you know about Danni?
Tell me everything you know about JV.
That wasn't so hard, was it?

pages.text: Alright fine what do you want to know?

choices.text: Aww.. What happened to your friendly disposition?

pages.text: Happy? Good, get the drek out of my club and never come back!
OUT!
It's true, I sold Coral to Danni every now and again. As far as I know, she got most of it from the people she was frequenting. That's all I know, I swear!

choices.text: What can you tell me about him?

pages.text: JV... Johan Visser. As you've guessed, he's my Coral contact.

choices.text: Building 19, huh. I should give that place a look.

pages.text: Not much, he's a very dangerous man. We meet at Building 19 in the industrial district. He tells me when and I show up with lots of credits and no questions. There's a code to get in: 3141.
Hello, Mr. Steel.
The person you've been looking for, Blake.
My name is Danni Ashton...

choices.text: Stand aside. Nobody tells Blake Steel where he can go.

pages.text: Sorry, you can't come in. Boss's orders.
AND STAY OUT!

choices.text: You and Glitch would get along.

pages.text: ... SegF4ult. With a '4' in the place of the 'A'.
You know Glitch? She's rad!

choices.text: Very well, Danni. Can you tell me what happened?

pages.text: Please, call me Danni.
Sure thing. It all started two nights ago...

That's when I reached out to my friend SegF4ult who's an expert cyberneticist. Once we figured out what was in there, I knew that they'd come looking for me, so I didn't dare reach out to Crystal and put her in danger.

choices.text: Xantech Cybernetics? Hold on a minute. That means...

pages.text: Danni had gigabytes of proof that Xantech Cybernetics created Coral for the specific purpose of getting people who bought cybernetics to continue to pay them money... indirectly. They've made billions already.
What? No. It's Xander Vane, Xantech's CEO!

choices.text: I bet he thought was real clever for that one. So, how did you find out about me?

pages.text: Xander Vane. XV. 15.
I heard that someone was looking for me. But I couldn't risk reaching out in case my phone was being traced.
Fortunately, there's no way that Xander could have my phone tracked. So an hour ago, we called Crystal on it and she told us all about you.
What she said, led us to believe we can trust you.
*Smirking* Let's just say you made a good impression on her.
Now I need you help. Xander knows I have this data... and he knows that I'm not dead. He's not going to stop until we make him stop.

choices.text: Hmm... If that data is as damaging as you say, it could possibly take him down. Or at the very least cause so many problems for him that you would be the least of them. What's the plan? Leak it to the press?

pages.text: We have to destroy him. With this data.
Eventually, but that's not going to be enough. He'll deny it and his lawyers will suppress it. Instead we have to go big.
Real big.

choices.text: ... then he's dreked. He won't be able to spin it or supress it!

pages.text: Tomorrow night, Xander will give a keynote at XanCon, unveiling his latest line of cybernetics. If we replace the demo reel that's supposed to play with this data...

choices.text: Sounds like you have a perfect plan.

pages.text: Exactly. He'll be publicly ruined.

choices.text: I have a feeling I'm not going to like this.
I can't wait to take this piece of drek down.

pages.text: This is where you come in. We can't risk exposing Danni and I'm, well, I'm more of a coder than a fighter.

choices.text: And how am I supposed to break into Xantech?

pages.text: You're going to need to break into the server room at XanTech and plug in a data stick that will override the demo reel.

choices.text: So I guess it's high time to have a meeting with Danni's... "dad."

pages.text: I'm not going to lie, it's not going to be easy. Other than Xander, only Visser has the access codes for the inner sanctum of the data center. Xander doesn't trust anyone else.

choices.text: Hmm... What If I call him and--

pages.text: We're going to need a good plan.

choices.text: Mr... Ashton. What a coincidence. I was just thinking about you.

pages.text: Mr. Steel. I hope I didn't catch you at a bad time.

choices.text: Then I know that you know that I know who you are.

pages.text: You can drop the pretenses, Mr. Steel. I know that you know who I am.
Do not play games with me, Mr. Steel. You are in no position to do so.
Blake!
Crystal!!
Crystal!

choices.text: I swear, you maniac, if you hurt a single hair on her--

pages.text: How touching.
Mind the theatrics, Mr. Steel. I won't need to injure a single follicle on her head if you and Danni do exactly as I say.

Isn't it obvious? I want Danni and my client's data. Your friend's health is completely out of my hands now.

Meet me at Building 19 in an hour. I trust you know the way.

choices.text: You are going  to do nothing. I'll rescue Crystal.

pages.text: Drek! Drek! Drek! What are we going to do?

choices.text: Don't worry, I'll think of something.

pages.text: How are you going to do that?
Blake!

choices.text: Mr. Ashton... or should I say Johan Visser. Xander Vane's lapdog.

pages.text: Yes, Mr. Steel. Be very careful.

choices.text: How did you know I'd found Danni?

pages.text: Aren't you resourceful.
Do you think you're the only one conducting their investigation tonight? No. I've been one step ahead of you this whole time.
It seems you came alone. How disappointing. After I dispose if your two corpses, I guess I'll --
Blake! Be careful, he's got a gun!
Hey, you dreking ball gag!
*GRUNT*
You'll need to do better than that.
You drek! *Punches me in the face*
*Dodges my blow* I'm not falling for that again. *Hits me in the stomach*
ARGH! Don't think you've won yet.
Ugh. You dreking animal. *Hits me in the face*
*Gasps* If that's how you want to play it...

choices.text: Did you know that in a PG-13 rated movie you're allowed one F-bomb?
I think you'd look good in ruby slippers.

pages.text: Any last words, Mr. Steel?
What?
Now's hardly the time to flatter me. Die!
Have it your way!

choices.text: I could ask you the same thing.

pages.text: Blake, are you hurt?

choices.text: I think we're good. Stay there, we'll be right over.

pages.text: Are you two ok, up there?
Oh Danni I'm so glad you're safe!

choices.text: Well, if it wasn't for Danni's timely distraction and your quick thinking, I'd have been done for. Thank you both.

pages.text: And you too, Blake!

choices.text: No kidding. By the way, Danni. I thought I told you to stay with SegF4ult, where it was safe!

pages.text: He shouldn't have underestimated us.
Yeah, no. And a good thing too.
By the way, I found this.
Drek that guy.
Take this datastick. It's got all the data primed for viewing. Seg says to just plug it in and it'll do the rest.
Great! Since Xander is still going to be looking for you, I need you two to head back to safety while I--

choices.text: Not going to be able to change your mind, am I?

pages.text: While I go with you. No way I'm staying out of this now.
Nope.
Be careful, you two! I'll head back to Seg's.
Crystal, would you like to go on a date to Xantech Cybernetics?
I thought you'd never ask.

choices.text: I need to enter the server room

pages.text: *Ksssh* HALT. *Ksssh*
*Ksssh* NO, YOU DON'T. *Ksssh*

choices.text: Why do you think I'm not?

pages.text: *Ksssh* I DON'T CARE. AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL ONLY. AND YOU'RE NOT AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL. *Ksssh*
*Ksssh* YOU'RE NEITHER MR. VISSER NOR ONE OF THE NERDS. BEGONE! *Ksssh*
Oh hey there. How are you?
*Ksssh* BA... ERR... UHM... OOF... AH... *Ksssh*
*Ksssh* HOW CAN I HELP YOU? *Ksssh*
It's the other way around. It's not easy keeping us all safe.
It's such a thankless job...
... and I want to show you my gratitude...
*Ksssh* UHHHH...*Ksssh*
... personally...
So I made you fresh cup of coffee!
*Ksssh* OH!... THANK YOU! *Ksssh*
Remind me to stay on your good side.
*Winks* Who said you were on my good side?
What a rack!
Thank you.
Great news, Blake!
Yes! I'm monitoring it from my place. We're good to go on our end. See you soon.
-- And this is my new Kickstart 4 cybernetic legs will change the world of sports.
They are available for purchase...
Right now!
Do it, Seg.
Up next, we have an innovation you won't believe--
-- and these dreking animals will eat it up.
-- Why should they stop paying us just because they got the product? With Coral, I *OWN* them.
-- They will give me every last credit and thank me, well, thank "KryptoKool" for it.
-- We're making billions!
What is going on?!
What is the meaning of this?
Visser?! Visser?! Where are you.
YOU!!!
You!? Do you you realize what you've done?! You ruined me!
And after all I've done for you?! You'd still be gutter trash if it wasn't for me!
You..
...Threw me...
... In the TRASH...
You left me to die.
You drek... You and your friends are dreking fishined! I will--
Mr. Vane. The Board is displeased and demands your presence immediately.
Who were they?
Enforcers for Cygnus Holdings, I'd imagine.
I almost feel bad for Xander.
Almost.
Who's a good girl, Daisy?
Boof!
Sorry, we're clos--
Even for a friendly face?
Boof!
I didn't know you had a dog! She's beautiful.
Is she a good girl?
The best.

regions.description: People having a good time. No gods, no kings, no rules.
Hmm... The bar looks fully stocked...
If you squint, the view is really nice.
The Lost Sock Laundromat... I guess that's where all the left socks go.
Doors to the upper level office.
Some papers on a small table.
Looking out the window, I see the industrial wasteland outside.
A trashcan. Nothing more of interest there.
I can't see them from this window.
No! No more looking in the trash!
Xantech Cybernetics. This was it. The beginning of the end for Xander Vane.
A medical bed. I wonder how often they need it.
A view of the city. Nothing but the best for Xantech employees.
